Update: I first want to start by thanking everyone for their kind words and advice. It truly meant more than you can ever imagine. This update isn?t the one I was hoping for but one that I thought might happen. I apologize if this is long.

I flew down with my best friend Thursday morning with the understanding that I would see him that afternoon. We had been communicating since he called me on Sunday. He even offered to pick me up from the airport, which I politely declined. I called and texted all afternoon, the phone was ringing and going to voicemails. My friend and I drove by where he was staying hoping we might see him outside or in the area. He didn?t respond to me until around 8pm and said sorry his phone was off and then stopped responding again.

Friday we woke up and came up with a plan that if he didn?t call me back or text me by 3PM I would request a wellness check. We actually weren?t sure how wellness checks work in that area so we drove to the local police station just to get some information. The officer I spoke with was so kind and empathetic which isn?t something I?ve experienced before with officers in situations regarding addicts. She gave me all the information I needed and included her personal cellphone number and asked that I update her if I hear back from my brother.

He texted me in the afternoon saying that his and the girl he?s with were going to sign a lease and should be done by 3:30pm. My friend and I were went to the hotel at 2:30pm and camped out by the parking lot entrance - this hotel only have one entrance into the parking lot so we would be able to see them come and go. By 4pm we haven?t seen them so I call him and he actually answered and said ?oh we just got back? and I said ?ok we?ll I?m outside your hotel, you need to come downstairs?. 20 minutes later they both came down. My friend moved the car because next to the entrance of the hotel has a little seating area where I was going to move them to so we could sit and talk. She wanted to be able to see me good forbid anything happened.

My heart sank when I saw him but I held in my tears. They are both so skinny. My brother specially is about 5?11 and couldn?t be more than 115 pounds. He had sores around his mouth from the crack pipe and track marks on his arms. His cheeks were hallow. He?s never looked worse, but I?m glad I had people prepare me to an extent, but it was still heartbreaking.

I kept the conversation light with them since they were both together because my goal was to get him alone to have a conversation. I did offer them both help and said I will drive them home both right now if they were ready. But they said they weren?t. However she said she was going to work at a bar at 6pm and I took that opportunity to tell my bother ?perfect let me take you for dinner!? He was declining at first but the girl he?s with encouraged him to go.

At dinner is where I got more serious. He doesn?t even remember calling me and saying those things. He only remembered parts when I texted him Monday saying I wasn?t driving down that day but I booked my flight for Thursday morning. He tried to tell me they?re not using as much as I think they are. I looked him right in the eyes and said ?you are addicts and you are lying to me?.

He told me all these plans they had about moving down permanently to where they are. Reasons they couldn?t come home. All the things people say when they aren?t ready. I?m proud of myself for not getting emotional because I needed him to know how serious I was about the things I was going to say next.

He told me that they planned on getting sober on 5/1 and I asked ?what are they waiting for? and he just closed his eyes and cried. He said ?Our heads are above water? and I said that?s not enough. I reminded him of the value he has, and the support he has and that while he will have to face his trauma when he gets sober that I will be there to support him. I reminded him that his best friend who doesn?t use (most of his friends also use back home) is desperate to here from him and to know he?s ok. She?s even offered that if he gets clean he can move in with her states away for a fresh start to get away from all his old friends and still have a support system.

He told me he?s not ready and doesn?t want help. I told him that if he continues like this I cannot have a relationship with him. That I can?t worry about if he?s dead or alive. I can?t spend my time calling random phone numbers hoping it?s his. That I can?t call police stations and hotels go find out information. That my mental health is can?t suffer because of his addiction.

He got so angry and started yelling at me asking how I could do this to him. That I?m the only person that has loved him through this no matter what. That I?m the only person he cares about enough to checkin with when he?s ready. That I?m the only person who tries to make sure he?s ok. I said I that I am not doing this to him, that his addiction is. He asked if he?s invited to my wedding in September and I said if you are not sober I cannot have you there. He started hitting the car dashboard and crying. He said he was getting out of the car and that they were planning to come home next weekend to visit for a few days.

I told him that he can call me but I will not answer. I told him that I loved him and I will always be there for him and that when he?s ready for help I will be there. I hugged him and cried and said ?I?m afraid this is the last time I?m going to see you?. He got out of the car and sat on the curb of the hotel entrance and cried. I drove away.

I obviously was hoping that the outcome was going to be different that he would come home and get help. That she would come home and get help. I knew that on a human level if he was ready and she wasn?t I would have to figure out a way to get her home. I?m friends with her sister and wouldn?t be able to leave her there on her own but I also knew going into it that they wouldn?t leave without each other.

I didn?t cry and haven?t cried since I left him. I went back to my hotel and slept and the next morning my friend and I got coffee and walked the beach before our flight. We actually saw a group of dolphins in the ocean which gave me this odd sense of peace. I know I did the right thing when he called me on Sunday and offered everything I could. But I set more boundaries around our relationship, ones that I will not go back on.

I have to regrets about going down and maybe I?m stupid to be hopeful that what I said left an impact and will help them realize it?s time for help, but I?m being realistic that they are going to continue to use until the end. Whatever their end maybe.

Original:My brother has been in active addiction for the last 10 years. I?ve watched him go from this giant personality who could light up a room to someone I no longer recognize.

He?s been missing since before thanksgiving and changed his phone number and hasn?t talked to anyone. His mail still goes to our dads house and I?ve been texting and calling the numbers on the phone bill just saying that I love him and I am always here for him no matter what.

Last night he finally called me just saying he loved me that he missed me and how sorry he was and that he needs me.

I don?t know if this is his cry for help but I will never give up on him. I booked my flights to where he is and will be going down Thursday with the hopes that I can bring him home and get him into treatment.

I?m not sure what to say when I get down there or really even what I should do. Any advice would be beyond appreciated. Even if this isn?t the time and he?s not ready, I just want him to know that no matter what when he?s ready I will be there.

I've dealt with addiction for a while and tryin to get over it but my addictions never been anything serious though. Lately I've been struggling a lot and I want to feel better. I got curious and looked through the stuff in the closet and found a bunch of pill bottles from family members past surgeries.

I used zoppies for sleep when I was 17. My mom uses them every night so it was easy. At 18, I realized how good they make me feel if I decide to stay awake instead. So, I started using them once a week for pleasure.

Then, I moved out and my depression got worse. I started finding excuses like "I was supposed to use tomorrow, but I'm going out tomorrow so I guess I gotta use today". Then, I realized that I couldn't stop anymore. Everyday without being high felt like shit in comparison. I was high basically every other day and was doing a lot of stupid shit like cutting myself while taking photos of it for my friends. It somehow made sense when high.

Then, my mom started using them more because of my brother went in jail for drugs so she needed more to sleep. Now she won't send me them anymore. I haven't used a single pill in over month. I'm 20 now.

But, now my mom has them again and I'm gonna see her today. I know how I'm happier without the pills. Especially since I've been without them for over a month already. I'm doing great and now is the best time to keep going.

But, just thinking about getting high today feels like I'm gonna see an old friend that I haven't seen in years. Every second I think about the pills, I physically feel amazing. I also haven't seen my friends or my dog in a month, but the fact that I miss the pills more than I miss my friends or my dog makes me sick.

This isn?t rocket science. I just took the classic addict route, I kept pushing until the consequences hit real hard. I?m not looking for sympathy, I?m just trying to process this.

I?m so disgusted by what I?ve done that I?m not capable of typing it yet? Because I know; my intellectual side is basically telling me you can?t go more wrong than this. Not just injuring yourself, but also putting others through lifelong issues.

? I think my emotional side still is hoping this will turn out all good, but it won?t, not this time. I might have screwed up before but this, oh shit, this is vile. There are so many levels of wrong doing, and the full scope of this hasn?t even been revealed yet.

I better just type some of the details, this is turning out pretty unclear. Contracted at least one blood STD, Hepatitis, afraid of HIV too to be honest. Married, pregnant wife at contraction, and a 4,5 y/o. This is about 6 month after that, because I?m showing symptoms and waiting for my hepatitis test result. I did screen for the regular STD:s before.

As I said, this is abominable, and I?m not looking for any petty. I?m merely typing this out for myself to process it. I know what kind of comments I?ll get already, because I wrote a similar post before during these events. And I fully agreed with every death wish.

Unfortunately I took the full addict arc. I thought I could manage until I couldn?t. Thought I was safe until I wasn?t. Thought I was in control until I wasn?t. Now I?ve put several lives in danger, and I?d probably continued if I would?ve gotten away with it.

I?ve straight up lied to my spouses face, even though she basically caught me. Her gut told her things weren?t adding up, but I stayed true to my (false) narrative. And this isn?t even the worst part. Reflecting upon my own behaviors I?m a complete self-centered coward; if I was truly worried more about them than me, I would?ve come clean a long time ago to precede potential risks. Now I?m still waiting for the test results, although I?m pretty sure what it will say this time, my symptoms are clear.

This is beyond repair, this is putting other lives in danger for a fix, and it?s pathetic that I haven?t manned up, I?m well aware.

Divorce is coming up and a life in solitude on my behalf. I couldn?t face anyone after this. But the fact that I?ve ruined my wife?s life and the upbringing of my two children is so much worse. I mean, it seems fair if she never wants to see me again, nor let me have anything to do with our children. And this is pure pain. And on top of that, there?s a great risk of life long chronic decease.

What I can?t wrap my head around is how I got here. I?m not stupid, on the contrary, people often regards me as clever and thoughtful. My moral compass was fine growing up, but in retrospect I can see it got screwed over time. And I had a decent upbringing, even though my parents were divorced. I thought I was too smart to possibly have caught some of the worsts STD:s known. On top of that - I?m a high school science teacher - I?m supposed to teach my students not to make these mistakes. I?m so detached from this side of my persona, it doesn?t feel like I could do these things.

I should just put an end to this pathetic monologue. As I said, this is probably some of the worst things you can put another person through, I?m well aware.

I knew they had a history of addiction/substance abuse and that they were a recovered addict. Found out the other day that they've been hiding their current relapse from me for months now. I've had to take them to the ER 4 times in the past month. They were recently diagnosed with a certain chronic disorder and we thought that was the cause of these episodes. We were even at one point both under the impression that it might even be a very serious and deadly disease and sought out specialists to get tests done.

One of the ERs we visited, which we went to twice, was fucking terrible and gave us no information whatsoever. They just gave them fluids and sent them home. It wasn't until the 3rd hospitalization that they told us "hey by the way...you're extremely intoxicated and that might be exacerbating the chronic illness you have". This shocked me because on the way to the hospital I asked them if they had anything to drink tonight and they said no, and i believed them because I was around them for the entire night and didn't see them drink a single drop of alcohol. When the nurse told us this I became extremely suspicious but thought I was overthinking things. We agreed: no more alcohol whatsoever.

I made sure to keep a good eye on them just in case, to make sure they weren't drinking, and for a couple weeks it seemed like they were making good on their promise. They had a few mild "episodes" after that that coincided with the chronic illness they were diagnosed with. And during those smaller episodes, they told me they had nothing to drink and I believed them because, again, I was around them and didn't see them drink at all.

Then the other day we had to take them to the ER again. I was beyond freaked out. We hadn't really gotten anything definite back from the specialist we were seeing and I thought the worst was going to happen; that they were going to die. I picked them up from the hospital and asked them again, "did you drink tonight?" and they told me "no". When we got home I noticed they did something weird: they went into our second bathroom, which I have never seen them use before. The second they came out I went in, did a quick search, and found a gigantic bottle of vodka hidden in one of the drawers. I confronted them about it and they finally admitted that they've been drinking HEAVILY these past few months, secretly and in incredibly elaborate ways, and using the fact that they were coincidentally, and legitimately, diagnosed with a chronic disorder to cover it up. I called their parents and we all set up an appointment at a rehab center.

I wasn't even mad at the elaborate betrayal or the lies and manipulation. I was, and am, just legitimately terrified, disturbed, and worried. I dropped them off today and while I'm glad they agreed to seek help I still mostly feel like I'm in shock and it hasn't really hit me yet. I have my own current struggles and history with substance abuse and addiction so I understand and just want to help. I just hate myself for not figuring this out/noticing this sooner. They aren't the type of person to normally lie or manipulate so I believed everything they told me. They might be in rehab for 3 months and there's no in-person visiting because COVID and I feel exhausted in every possible way. I know they're in good hands but I'm shocked that it went this far/got this bad. They're one of the nicest, sweetest, and most selfless persons I've ever met and I just want them to be okay.

I really can't remember, I had taken a small break to pass a drug test and that was on Wednesday. After the test I left and got geeked. It was a wild week. I know I slept one time a little bit after 8 am and slept in until 5. And then I went and got geeked again. I can't go to sleep yet due to family. I don't know why I did this to myself. I have to stay up for at least 5 more hours. I don't know if I can make it. Started with auditory hallucinations and then somewhat real visual ones nothing too crazy though. I've had to play cool because of my family being with me. I have someone coming over to help me sleep tonight but that's in like 5 hours. I drink two 5-hour energies about an hour ago but now my body feels really high and I can't stop shaking. This may have been the stupidest string of decisions I've ever made. I gotta ditch my using buddies. I am trying to stay standing and taking little breaks to sit / squat in position that I can't crash in. Every time I stay up for more than 2 days I start getting those auditorium hallucinations and they really freak me out. This time around they sound so real. I just keep hearing songs that I already know sometimes ones I haven't heard or thought about in forever. Just 5 more hours.

So we moved to this apt building like less than a year ago, and it's been nothing but hell. Worst part is our management who keeps brushing things off like they don't exist. There are a bunch of people live across from us, and they've been smoking some kind of substance, we aren't sure what it is. Smell's awful 1am- till 8 am, right before management office opens. It keeps us awake all night, and gives us headaches. I honestly can't even think or do anything when I smell it, that's how bad it is. Smell's nothing like cigarettes, or food. I smell weed every now and then, but that's not it either.

Long story short, we've told management about it over and over and they won't believe us. It's like they're trying to cover it up or something. Keeps telling us they don't smell it in the morning, and they changed filter and they couldn't find anything on it.

One time we called the cops, at 3 am, officer wouldn't knock on the door, since it was late. And told us to follow up with management. We're going nuts. How could they get away with it like that? And how would you prove it to manager, or they know about it and trying to cover it up?

Hello 25(M)

I have a real problem with cam sites. Since i was 14 years old i started with porn and eventually through an add i started using cam sites. I was just 13 or 14 years old when this happens(wrong) but it is the truth. I spend money on it from time to time. Sometimes a lot and there always was a lot of guilt and shame when i was ?done? then i would quit for a while but for some stupid reason i always come back to them. There are periods in my life i havent used the sites for a long long time( years) but it seems that for some reason i always go back to them in hard times. This problem is coming on and off throughout my life.

I am in a beautiful relationship with the most beautiful girl on this planet. She truly is everything i need. We are lovers, buddys, best friends and all together. We had our ups and downs in our relationships like most people have. Some rough and difficult stuff but we always managed to work things out. After 2 or 2,5 years into the relationship for some reason i came back to those cam sites for the stupid dopamine rush. I feel/felt terrible in those moments after i was done. I tried making stupid excuses to myself that it was just ?like porn? or something familiar. But it really isnt. I dont get it, there is absolutely nothing wrong in our relationship, she is beautiful and im satisfied in every way( emotionally and sexually) we have great sex. It has absolutely nothing to do with her or that there is something missing in the relationship. Yet i still come back to those sites to feel terrible shame and guilt afterwards. To just repeat that again.. i have a history of addiction with substances like marijuana, alcohol and benzos. So addiction is definitely a thing that im dealing and have dealt with in my life. I am completely sober now for a couple of months by the help of some ayahuasca ceremonies and im getting myself together and things are finally going into a very good direction.

Yesterday there was a moment that i felt that i had to tell my lover so i did. She was shocked by it and felt like i have cheated on her which i understand. She was mad, sad, very upset and feels horrible because of it. And it hurts me so much to see her with that pain. To tell her something like this.. she didn?t expected it at all and she feels cheated on. I am so sorry for what i have done. I feel ashamed, terrible, discusted, guilt, grief, sad and so bad about myself. I have told her because ineeded to come clean otherwise i couldn?t live with myself anymore.

She was in complete shock and today on Valentines day she told me she needed to go home and be alone for a while to think things through. I feel horrible, i am afraid that i have ruined the relationship and that she wont be able to forgive me and see it as just a problem i have been having that i developed since i was younger. I feel like i have lost my beautiful girl and i cant live with myself. Although she said she needs time im so afraid that she cant live with this.

I showed her all my transactions of the payments of the camsite throughout the years and it broke her heart seeing that and it broke my heart seeing her react to it like that also.. i just want to move on with her.. i feel lost, hopeless and ashamed.

She is everything for me and i hope she can see it has nothing to do with her or anything like that.. i know one thing for sure. Im quitting that shit for good because i cant live like this anymore..

Can somebody give me some advice for how to deal with this or what to do. Im already sure i wont ever do it again just by seeing what it did to the relationship. But im afraid, lost and hopeless right now. She is everything for me..

I know there is a list with different resources but I?m not exactly sure how to utilize them. My boyfriend and I are struggling with addiction, specifically to cocaine and pornography, but alcohol is involved as well. I want to get help but not sure where to start. I?d rather an online program of some sort because some of the topics are personal and we don?t feel comfortable talking about them face to face with people. We are also pretty busy so we need a program that is flexible with our lifestyle.

This is day three of being awake. I don?t want more adderall because my heart will explode and I don?t want the rush at this point, but the further it?s out of my system the more heartbroken and hopeless I become due to the addiction. I?ve taken a ridiculous amount, but that?s nothing new. But I don?t go out anymore and have lost all of my charisma and the anxiety has made me agoraphobic to a degree. And I?m going to think that the cravings are gone tomorrow as usual, until they come back and make me a pathetic helpless addict again the day after. My friends all know (to an extent) but they don?t attack me for it, instead they?re disappearing from my life slowly but surely. 24 m. Need a hug to say the least

I?ve always been very good at hiding things, and my addiction is no different. I?m a great liar, and too proud of it. I?ve been hooked on pills for about a year. I?ve managed to avoid becoming physically dependent on anything because I switch up what I do very frequently, I basically have a rotation of 7 or 8 drugs that I enjoy. Of course I have a favorite, oxy, but I tried to spread things out like I said to not build a tolerance or physical dependence on anything. I thought I ?outsmarted? addiction. I couldn?t possible become addicted, but I recently realized that addiction is a mental game, not a physical one. I have yet to actually face any hard consequences of my abuse, which is another reason I never considered myself ?addicted?.

I am a college student with big plans for the future. I want to go to law school and work in health law. Too many people are getting fucked by the system (but that?s another post). I am doing well in school, 3.7 and making deans list every semester. Scored a 165 on my first practice LSAT. So I know law school is obtainable, but I would be doing even better in school if I quit all the pills.

Currently my biggest problem is that I am an athlete at my school. I have yet to be drug tested because they are random, but I would be absolutely fucked if I was tested. (Though maybe they would assume it?s an error if I tested positive for everything lol.) I don?t even want to think about the consequences of that. For weed, most people just get a warning for the first positive test, but I have heard my school is super strict about anything else. I would likely be cut from the team, and that would be bad for many reasons. Aside from losing the little scholarship money I get (I play a pretty niche sport, so even at the top level we don?t get much money), I would be losing all of my best friends. My team has become my family. I love them with all of my heart and would do anything for them.

My head coach told me at practice yesterday that he noticed that I had lost weight and it was seemingly muscle mass that I lost, and he knows I?ve been in the gym everyday so it didn?t make sense to him. I think he was concerned might I have an ED. I finally came clean to him and told him everything. I told him about my shitty childhood full of abuse, both physical and mental, how my dad hates me for being gay, my suicide attempt, and my drug problems. It felt really good to open up and tell someone something. Like I said, I?m good at hiding things, and because of trust issues, I hide most things from most people. His reaction was better than I ever could have imagined. He basically told me that he?s been in my position before and that he will do whatever he can to help me, and he doesn?t want to get me in trouble, with school or my parents.

We came up with a plan together to help me. Firstly we are going to meet at least once a week and talk, I have to keep him updated. I can call him anytime for any reason. If either of us think I need it at any point, he will arrange professional help. If I show up to practice, team meetings, games, or anything else drunk or high he will make me leave. And if I drink or use the day before or day of a game I will be riding the bench. And biggest of all if I lie to him about any of this, he will have to talk to the school. This may seem way too loose, like he should be making me stop everything all at once, but he knows because he?s been in my position that this is the best starting place, and this is how we will build trust in each other. I know that over time he will tighten up his ?rules? for me. I am so incredibly grateful to him. He treated me with nothing but acceptance, love and respect. He made sure to tell me not to feel guilty or ashamed, and that we will get me through this together.

I don?t think he?ll ever see this, but just in case: Coach K, thank you, I promise I will put the work in, this isn?t how my story ends.

i used to be an asshole for drugs. i orchestrated my entire life around who was fun to do lines with, pop pills and get wasted. i smoked ritalin, dipped cigarettes in codeine, OD?d on benzos and opioids, and made enough cocaethylene in my metabolism to stay drunk for two straight months. my drinks were always strong too. my drink of choice runs about 160 proof. i used to live for the drip in the throat and the feeling of bestial immortality from hitting a line of cocaine. i was introduced to treatment when i went off the rails and crashed my car, lost my job, my relationships, and my sanity all at the same damn time. i urge you if you?re struggling to read what i write here as proof that there is no nobility in drug use. it truly is a better life for me as a sober individual. i won?t speak for others, but i am better at everything i used to only do high, i am able to function emotionally without the weight of guilt and the slow lonely death spiral of drugs and depression that comes with the territory. i feel better than ever and i want to keep going. i never imagined what straight edge was like and i never could, i hope whoever reads this does.

I can't stand it, I procrastinate, I feel anxious, I never know what to say or do, and I've always got something niggling at the back of my head

And I just love being intoxicated in anyway to do anything

I will always end up justifying it to myself either, I did 300mg md with a mate yesterday because our 2cb had ran out, that was the just if action for that time, then just a couple hours ago I took 2 E pills just to justify finishing a school essay. I can't keep my shit together and I feel like nothing I ever do is good enough, but I can never motivate myself when I'm sober. And when I'm high I can still do the work and not he sober. I feel trapped. Sorry I don't make much sense.

I was feeling so empowered a few weeks ago when I got a gym membership and hadn't used anything in so long

I ahte my life so much I honestly just want to off myself so much. Its easily 20% of my thoughts/daydreams. Tha ks for reading my little rant

I?m 35. I?ve probably smoked cigarettes for close to 20 years now. A few years ago I got a new car, and refused to smoke in it. Also decided to not smoke at work(I work in a restaurant. You know, where you really only get breaks if you smoke?). The next steps were the bar and home. Covid took care of one of those for long enough for me to not think about it. Then it was just home.

3 weeks ago my partner and I were at a local casino, and we stepped into the smoking area for maybe 15 minutes(he smokes regularly). We stayed the night in the hotel there, and when we got up and got dressed in the morning, my hoodie I was wearing the night before almost made me gag. I didn?t notice it at the time but, that smell was overwhelming.

I haven?t had a cigarette since. For the record I do have an ?On!? brand nicotine pouch in my mouth a few times a day. But, besides that, even with the partner and the roommate both being regular smokers?.the cravings basically don?t exist. It?s crazy to me.

Somebody motivate me to take a jog, or join a gym or something.

After 8yrs of meth use I achieved over 3 yrs of sobriety, then over a wk ago I used for 4days.

I don?t have any cravings or nostalgia for using again, I don?t feel like I?ve lost 3yrs nor do I believe that I?ve failed.

I have an understanding of what led me back to that other world and I?m working on how to improve my recovery program and to create a better relapse prevention plan.

I?m humbled by my relapse, it?s a good reminder that no matter how well things are going for me I?m still vulnerable and that I need to respect that vulnerability in myself cause it?s not ever going to go away.

I tell myself that its not like im addicted to something truly detrimental so why do i need to quit?

I need to quit because my lifes going nowhere and it feels like its been on hold since i started smoking. I have no money left as soon as i get some because it all goes on bud and im beyond tired of the cycle.

Im considering going back to inpatient detox because i did it once before and it felt so good to be free. I went because of coexisting mental illness so its safer/easier for me to detox under supervision. My addictions worker is looking into it for me since we had a chat about it last week.

It feels so crazy to have such a dependency on weed and im getting to a point where im ready to say goodbye. I just hope it comes sooner rather than later.

Just found (really found) box under bed. 8x Rivotril 2mg, 2x Xanax 2mg, 6x Tramal 200mg, 2x Oxycodone. Yesterday I get new Beretta. Hm, thinking about it like very dangerous combo. Is it only coincidence, or some sort of sign?

I'm cutewcntly gurning like a mfer with my eyes occasionally rolling back in my head, all to be stimulated to do my essay due for tomorrow.

I'm peaking and distracted now so I just want to say I don't thi k I've ever met anyone on this sub who is judgemental or a prick in anyway. Everyone is so kind and understanding, it really feels like a tight-knit community where everybody understands and will help each other.

I hate my birthday. The last 2-3 years something really significant and awful has happened on my birthday. This would have been the first birthday I?ve had clean in a long time. I got into my head too much on friday about my birthday and I decided to get some pain killers. I had 7 months, which was significant for me.

I ended up going to work on saturday after I popped way too many and started feeling funny. I got a 2 hour break (working a double) and decided to go home and take more.

My body decided that was too much and I felt like I was about to OD. So I call my friend at work (who is also in recovery) and tell her the situation. She ended up leaving work to drive me to the ER and I obviously didn?t make it for the rest of the shift.

Now fast forward to today, I work in one hour and i?m beyond terrified to go. I?m super anxious because my friend told the managers what happened (they were aware of my recovery) and i?m just nervous if the word got out to the other workers or if i?m gonna get treated different.

I relapsed at the beginning of January; I had 8 mo of sobriety. I knew my life would get fucked up, but this fucked up was unimaginable.

I had a severe lung infection last yr from a combination of smoking dope and asperating due vommitting. They diagnosed it as asperation pneumonia, but it was a very unclear diagnosis. It was so traumatizing, and my fear relapsing this time was it recurring again, it did exactly that. About two weeks ago I asperated, and my lung infection, or, whatever it is, came back full force. I've been to the er 3 times already, and they don't know what's wrong with me, yet again. My O2 levels are extremely low. I can't get any sleep without waking up in the middle of the night and struggling to catch my breath. Constant coughing and wheezing. It's been a nightmare. I'm reliving it all over again.

I'm trying to not smoke dope, but snorting it doesn't really do anything for me, and it feels like dope is the only thing that slightly subsides the pain of this. I'm back to being dope sick again, my tolerance is high and I'm spending all of my money on this shit; I had 1k in savings, which is the most I've ever had saved up in my entire life, now I'm in the negatives. only after 1 month of using. 1 month.

I'm out of work due to this lung infection and also the fear of getting dope sick while at work. I've been at this job for 6 mo and it was the only source of stability that I had. and I'm on the fringe of getting fired.

I admitted to my family I had a relapse, I just wanted to be honest and tell on myself, that was a huge mistake. My family has been so proud of me, they finally had trust in me, they were happy for me, for the first time in years I felt like I had my family back. Now they have lost all trust in me and my recovery. We are barely on talking terms, and when we are it's very awkward and I'm constantly berated with questions and accusations.

My relationship with my partner is slowly falling apart due to both of us using, and our relationship for 8 months of both having clean time was so strong, healthy, and communicative and now it's in fucking shambles again.

My mental and physical health is plummeting. Relapsing was so god damn not worth it. It's crazy that after only a month of using my life is back to where it was 8 months ago. It's true, when you relapse you just end up back exactly where you were, if not worse. This shit is so evil. This drug is so fucking evil. For anyone contemplating relapsing, I really hope you find the strength inside yourself to not do it, to just stay clean and sober for today, for tonight, for the next hour, for the next second. You're worth so much more than this. You can overcome the cravings as hard as it is. it's not worth it. I wish I told myself this before I relapsed, I wish I replayed those fucking tapes. Remember how you felt right before you got sober and why you got sober. It's not fucking worth it for any drug or drink. You'll end up right back to the same place, there's no rock bottom, it can always get worse, and it will. It always does.

I have done it again. I have relapsed.

I recently came to the insight that it wasn't working the way I was using amphetamine once again.

I had to become honest to myself and to my girlfriend that I live with, which is a very hard thing to admit, I think for every addict. I do not want to hurt the people I love and care for.

This is the second time I have to do this here. And it breaks my heart. This cycle has repeated itself with my x as well.

I am tired of this, and I'm tired of myself. But I'm trying not to be too harsh on myself; it's counterproductive.

I can?t believe I am finally writing this. It?s been a long time coming. Long overdue, to say the very least. The last thirty years with you has been one big roller coaster ride. We?ve been through many ups and downs in life.

I could still vividly recall the first time we met. I was 15 years old and in high school. My friends and I chipped in and paid someone to buy you for us. We all drank at Pacific Avenue in Stockton that day. Back then, it was the cool thing to do. I wanted to be one of the cool guys that everyone wants to hang out with. That very first experience with you turned out to be the first of many.

In all my milestones you were there ? high school graduation, first job, first paycheck, first enlistment, first car, first marriage, first child, first home? it was pretty cool that you were there during all those firsts in my life?. man, you truly made a mark!

You were there during the many times I failed: my first divorce, my first foreclosure, my first garnishment? my first grief. You were there by my side when I lost my first love. The most beautiful part of my existence: my mother. She was everything to me. When I lost her, I had also lost a huge part of myself.

Apart from the pain of losing the love of my life, there?s the other kind of pain. Serving in the Army was no easy feat. I had to deal with a lot of stress and trauma. For 24 years, I coped with the physical and mental pain through self-medication. I had to put up a strong face even though I was slowly dying on the inside. I wanted to give up, but I could not stand the disappointment that it would cause my family. So I learned how to fake my feelings, my emotions. It was hard to pretend that I was happy, when I was really this angry, frustrated, lonely person carrying a lot of baggage.

Through all my ups and downs, you were the only constant in my life. You never left my side. You were always there to hold my hand. And I misconstrued that for loyalty, for trust, for love. When all it was was Control. Deception. Betrayal.

I?m not very good with goodbyes. Goodbyes are always painful. But I have to accept that nothing lasts forever. It?s time to part ways, my old friend. Before I close this final chapter of our relationship, let me leave you with one of my favorite Bible quotes: For everything there is a season. A time for every activity under heaven. A time to be born and a time to die. A time to plant and a time to harvest. Ecclesiastes 3:1-8.

I?m not able to post on the subreddit dedicated to this, and nobody has posted in 136 days.

I have kleptomania. Never diagnosed or anything but I think I?m addicted to stealing. I?ve never stolen from anyone I know, never from a small business, never from anyone who would suffer from it. It?s only whenever I go to huge multi billion dollar corporations. But it?s dangerous for myself. I?ve been doing this for years and I don?t know how I?ve never been caught. I need to stop. I have a career. I have a child. I have a partner. And absolutely nobody knows. It feels good to get something for free, it feels like when you just got something on a really good sale. Sometimes it?s personal goods like body wash or eyeliner. Sometimes it may be food. A lot of times, I only do it if I feel like it?s too expensive to justify buying it, but I really want or feel like I need it. For example, I might ?forget? to scan a package of chicken breasts, because all they had was the organic kind and I can?t afford how pricey it is. It?s become so normal for me now that I feel like I?ve been ripped off if I make a big shopping trip and pay for all of this. I need to stop. I know eventually my luck will run out and I?ll get caught. I can?t keep doing this. I?m addicted to it. I need to stop before it?s too late.

I haven?t been able to bring myself to tell anyone this not even my closest friends.. probably because it is so painful for me to admit even to myself. But I am at a breaking point, I can?t hold it in any longer. My husband has been addicted to fentanyl for 9 months, that I know of. He began two months before I gave birth to my daughter and I found out just a few weeks postpartum. I had suspicions when I noticed the tiny pupils and always tired. Then we suddenly had no money ever and he would leave the house and be gone all day. I discovered a stash of tinfoil needles and cotton swabs and he finally admitted to it after gaslighting me for weeks making me feel crazy. The stress and depression and absolute heartbreak that has overcome me is stronger than anything I have every experienced. I never imagined this could ever happen. He was the best partner and person I ever had the opportunity to love and build a life with. I am crushed and absolutely devastated and I have known for 7 months now. I approached the situation with love and support, took care of him through two bouts of withdrawals, the first time while taking care of my newborn baby too. He has relapsed both times now and continues to lie directly to me about it, no matter how loving and understanding I try to be. I still find tinfoil and baggys in our laundry. I am falling apart witnessing his own self destruction. He actually overdosed when I first became pregnant. Was driving my car and went unconscious behind the wheel. He was arrested and is still on probation from that occurrence. He told me it was laced in marijuana that he smoked and I blindly believed him. At this point I am losing faith in him and I don?t think I will ever be able to trust him again, I fear our relationship is beyond repair. I feel broken and crazy. I love him so deeply and just want this nightmare to end. I miss him so much, he is a ghost of the man he used to be. I know deep down he wants to get better. But the disease of addiction has it?s grip on his body mind and soul. I feel so lost and powerless. The anxiety and fear of him dying haunts me everyday. When-he is asleep I find myself checking to see that he is still breathing. Please pray for us. I don?t want to leave him and have my daughter grow up in a broken family like I did. But I am at the point where I think of what life could be like if I do leave. And I don?t want her to be subjected to his addiction. Staying and witnessing is just too painful. Please pray for us.

He?s been clean of all IV use for 3 years, clean of opiates for a year and a half, and clean from crack for THREE MONTHS!! Even before that he was only relapsing like once or twice a month, which was a HUGE change from 2020 when he was using 200$ worth per day or more.

As for me, I haven?t had a drink or done any hard drugs for all of 2022 so far. My problems with substance abuse definitely are smaller than his? a 14 year habit/lifestyle for him versus me just really doing it in massive binges to Escape (tm) from severe trauma and somehow luckily not getting sucked in to daily use. But still i know it?s an unhealthy pattern for me and I wanted to change so that him and I can be happier and healthier together. :)

I love you guys! Change is possible, your journey to sobriety may be messy and imperfect and marked with relapse but for a lot of people that?s just how it has to be done. Abruptly changing your life is terrifying to your brain and for a lot of people small changes over time work better. If you can?t quit 100% today, do what my BF did and quit IV first. Then work on quitting your most dangerous habit, without worrying about any other ones. Take it a day at a time and treat yourself with honesty and kindness. You got this!

I (24f) since I was 16 years old have struggled with getting to sleep and staying asleep for longer than 2-3 hours. There are some days/weeks that are good and I sleep well and then I am back to this. At 16 I started self-medicating to help me sleep and I would take literally anything that had a sedative in it: anti-allergies, painkillers, cough syrups. I would never take more than the prescribed amount but I would still take them regularly. I would stop in the middle when I had moments of panic about what I was doing and then I?d go back to it. When I went to university, I start taking clonazepam almost regularly and if I couldn?t get that I would take lexotinal. It really ducked me up and I had a breakdown at one point where I confessed to friends that I felt like an addict, and I abused prescription pills. I have worked really hard on stopping this and have mostly not succumbed except for short periods or where my mental state has been in a place where I need something to put me to sleep. At times I don?t even know if the medicine will help me sleep, I just want to take it and hope that it does.

However, sometimes I?ll see these medicines around or develop random cravings to take them despite not experiencing any issues. I recently started taking levosulpiride again which a doctor had recommended to me sometime ago but the prescription had ended. There?s no reason for me to have started it except that I have had a few bad nights despite having ample time to make up for the lost sleep but I saw the pack and I couldn?t help it and I noticed how all day today all I could think of was planning how to get more once I ran out. I don?t think this is even about getting to sleep anymore.

Is this an addiction?

I lost my incredible boyfriend in January. He had been sober from fentanyl for 7 months, lived in sober living, attended several meetings every week, was on vivitrol, SSRIs, and saw a therapist every week. From my perspective, he was doing so well. He told me he wasn?t having cravings anymore, that he was feeling really good and happy. He went to visit some family in another state and apparently he was having a really hard time. I say apparently because he didn?t tell me, his family told me later on. He started using again and overdosed and passed away 2 days later. The day of, he had a seizure and was hospitalized, then taken home where he likely used again and passed away. I?m having such a hard time understanding why he continued to try to get high despite being on vivitrol. Maybe I am missing something about how it works? Maybe there is nothing to make sense of out this. Im just grieving an amazing man and trying my best to understand him and his disease.

This is longer than i?ve ever expected to make it, and i?m actually trying to get life together. but i can?t stop thinking about it - the feeling of being completely out of control with no regard for yourself. i know it sounds terrible but it?s like a bad relationship. once it?s over, you start to only remember the good. I need to remember all those mornings i spent strung out and depressed.

Tell me why the first thing my auntie says to me is "I thought I told you to get off them pills ray" and as soon as she said that i knew my mom told them that I OD'd and all I wanted to do was curl into a ball and forget the world. It just made me wish even more that I didnt wake-up from my overdose. Cause its one thing to have your mom know youre fucked up on pills but for my grandma and auntie to know... I don't even know. I just didnt wanna be alive cause its fucking embarrassing. I wanted this to be my own thing to worry about. Not my whole family to know. I'm a pretty functional drug addict but a heavy user nonetheless: anything goes, heroin, synthetic opioids, cathinones, meth, MDMA, LSD, weed, synthetic noids, benzos, coke, salvia, LSA, Kratom, you name it... there's barely a day I'm not on something and this has been going on for maybe 15 years with relatively few (yet dramatic) incidents.

But this is rapidly changing, I have been falling in love with a girl I recently met, and even though while things were really uncertain with her my stress caused my drug use to skyrocket, now that we have made some steps that make me think (knock on wood) this relationship could actually evolve to where I so desperately desire it to, that is, that she loves me back, I have all of a sudden lost most of my desire to get high because there is nothing that I desire more in the world than to be able to be with her, healthy and clean, to give to her all of the good things I am capable of giving, cherish her with all of my unadulterated heart and thoughts, and fucking LIVE this life with her, till the end if God permits.

I'm crying like a river writing these lines and no, I'm far from being a teenager experiencing his first love.

I am cleaning my act up as fast as I can. It's not that I could not be honest with her, I haven't told her anything about it but she's such a free spirit with an open mind that I would have no shame it telling her my life's story in details.

It's just that I don't wanna be that person with her. I think I've finally realized that that gaping hole in my heart I was filling up with drugs was that absence of a significant other in my life.

The non physically addictive drugs are already stopped. I think I still need a couple of days, one week tops to get rid of benzos and opiates cuz you know, avoiding to die would be best, but never in my life have I been se motivated to quit.

I'm ready to endure whatever withdrawal has in store for me. That pain, when I think of it as a way to be free to enjoy life with her means nothing at all to me. I'd do anything. Withdrawal, have at me, here I am and here I'll stand, proudly and relentlessly blow after blow until my step is firm and my hands stable.

But that also scares me to death. What if things don't pan out as I hope they will? I've had post break-up depressions in the past that have led me to suicide attempts that nearly succeeded.

Also, I can't help but wondering whether it's that better to become that attached to a person than to a drug. Drugs in my experience are more reliable than people. How will I cope? How will I survive in between "fixes" (seeing her, texting her, calling her...). And we all know relationships end one way or the other, with separation or death. So how much better is that really if she leaves me and I just kill myself?

I'm not reducing her to a drug of course, she's a wonderful woman, the analogy is just made by my sick brain, but that is the way I seem to work psychologically.

78 days free from alcohol, 81 days free from pills. My cravings are mostly gone, except random ones that popup just to pester me. My recent lab results show my liver is fairly badly damaged, though. I have to go for more testing over the next few weeks to see how far the damage goes, and what we'll have to do about it. It's a weird feeling, knowing that only after I stop all my drugs is when my body finally starts failing. And it's even weirder that my response to this distress is to want to use/drink again. I know that'll only make it worse, plus it'll ruin what good things have been going on in my life lately. But for years, getting my response to distress was to get wasted. My therapist is helping me learn new coping skills. They do help. But there's a certain pleasure in being so far gone that nothing matters. Until the crash, I guess.

I'm not going back. I've made it this far, I'm not going to throw it all away. I just wanted to say it all somewhere. I haven't told anyone about my liver, yet. I'm waiting for more answers before I tell my friends and boyfriend. I don't want to worry them more than I have to. Maybe the treatment can be all quiet, even. We'll see.

Recently (this week) my fianc left me due to lack of trust . I wasn?t using at the time but I wasn?t honest with her about how I used close to three months before . A week ago on a Thursday I had a seizure and woke up in her bathroom and told her I passed out and was yelling for her help. I told her that I was on drugs . Idk why I told her that I just did apparently on the way to the hospital . I don?t remember the whole day because I had a seizure and forgot. She stayed with me throughout the CT scan and everything . When we got home the next morning . Seizure happened at 10 pm . went to ER and was in ER until 6am . I could tell she was done with me. The most pain I have felt In my life . I love this woman. She?s made me feel normal for a while now. I was so ashamed because I felt like I overdosed . Turns out opiates weren?t in my system . Or heroin . Etc I have been so conditioned to fucked up things I believed it was normal thing to say . It must have been the drugs. I?ve only had one seizure before in my life 6 years prior and was sober then as well. But after ten years of autonomy usage I just figured i did drugs and passed out. The urine panel came back clean and I started questioning deeper things. Why did I jump to saying I did drugs that must have been why I passed out? Why did I say anything about drugs if I hadn?t used in months. Usually my go to is a perk/Roxy . About 3-4 at once . Well I haven?t had them recently. She told me after finding out about a clean urine test if I took a hair test she?d begin to believe me . That?s when I was extremely honest and said well 3-4 months prior I did pills at my fathers house. My dad is an addict / alcoholic and has been since I was 16. (After the divorce he had he turned to substance abuse) I learned to normalize that behavior . The first time I saw anyone do a line it was him. I was 16 and came home for thanksgiving that week. He snorted it and acted somewhat normal(for him at least) then I just thought it was okay. Well if pops does it and is fine I?ll be okay. Well that transformed into more quickly. I went back to va from ms and began selling spice in school. (k2 when it came out) I got expelled that feb and moved back to MS with my dad immediately to get a GED. I didn?t do my first pill til that summer and it made all the pain go away mentally and physically. I loved that shit. 100s of pills later and tens years And fast forward to getting kicked out of my fianc house . She was shocked when I tested clean and told me if I do a hair test she?ll start to gain my trust again and I jumped at the idea of it but then I call her back and express I was scared because the pills from months before might show up. She expresses how it?s not the drugs so much as it?s the lying and trust. I respect her decision and know she was my angel but I have to let her heal . Opiates played such a big role in my life that it sounded normal to say I overdosed even when I was sober. If you?re reading this don?t let pain control you . Fucked up things happen to the best people but don?t let it run your life it ran mine. Pills can?t take this pain away but I?m glad I?m at this point. I?m sober and staying sober . It?s not just going to a meeting it?s going and keep going. I love y?all and I don?t know y?all but don?t let pain run it?s course on you find out how to get rid of it healthily . I?ve been using since 17 and I?m just now strong enough to admit I have a demon and I will defeat it .

So I?ve been battling it out with Kratom. However at some point in December I turned a corner and decided I?m don?t with my own bullshit (?real change happens when you?re done with your own bullshit?). So I called a school doing something I always wanted to do (software development) and started to get the ball rolling, I changed my work schedule to work well with taking classes and started studying. I stoped smoking cigarettes and decided that I could not study for school if I was smoking weed, it?s hard to study stoned. So I stopped weed so I can always be ready to study and handle my business. Shortly after that I decided I want to feel normal.. like a human, so I?m currently quitting coffee. I realized that after I have coffee I tend to have to reach for kratom to balance myself out? so I would get the ball rolling with coffee then I would HAVE to reach for these other substances to balance myself out? so why not stop ?the source?. I am feeling a lot better and as I mentioned before: I am weening off of kratom (the thing that I have a dependence on). During the morning when I would feel my worse I would automatically reach for it. However a few mornings ago I sat with feeling for awhile and it took about 20 minutes (of hell) but I turned a corner and the ?agony? I felt mellowed out. I didn?t know that would happen. It?s been years since I allowed myself time without that. Currently I?m tapering off and I hope to be 100% off of everything so I can experience what it?s like to be a ?human?.

I wish you all the best, you are more amazing then you know.

Ps. I started to process my pass traumas a few years ago and that was a huge part of me taking steps to cleaning my life up.

So I (24/f) have been struggling with self-harm / addiction for the past 11 years, which includes cutting, poly-substance abuse, and eating disorders. Ive been addicted to cigarettes, cannabis, cocaine, amphetamines, opiates/opioids, benzodiazepines, and alcohol. I think I use substances and use the EDs as another form of self-harm, and as a way to escape the crippling anxiety and severe depression. My father (who I no longer see or speak to) is an emotionally and physically abusive addict. I also have anger issues, which I attribute to him especially.

The eating disorders are related to the substance abuse; I used stimulants to maintain a low weight and getting drunk was the only way I would eat. Then I started drinking so much that I binged my way back up to a healthy weight. I'm still in then normal BMI range, but not that far from being overweight. Now I drink to forget how much weight I've gained.

I've attempted suicide, overdosed countless times, gone through horrible withdrawals, and seen the face of death multiple times. I even had a heart attack, at age 20. Still i suffer with palpitations, and struggle to breathe especially when lying down on my back. I've been to the doctors about this, but they say my vital signs, X-rays, and EKGs all come back fine.

The substances I am currently using include oxycodone and morphine (5-10 mgs a few days of the week), the occasional cigarette, the occasional bowl of cannabis, Adderall (20mg every other day) and I drink alcohol everyday, which I am physically dependent on (something like a 6-pack and bottle of wine) . Some days I'll drink a little less, some days more. But I have to drink consistently the throughout the day to avoid withdrawal. It's incredibly painful.

I feel physically sick from the substance use and my anxiety is so bad, I've been having anxiety attacks every day. He paid for my school and said if I fail this semester I can just try again next semester. I've been to rehab a few times, never more than a week. The last one was nice, but they thought I was suicidal (which I wasn't - I only admitted that I had tried to kill myself before) and they kicked me out. Someone please help me, I feel like I'm going to die before I'm even 25. I'm sorry this is so long btw ):

Last month she had to narcan me 3 times to get me back. She thought I was gone already, they had no idea how long I was out. I?ve been to the same detox facility twice as well as two different stays in residential treatment facilities. They were supposed to each be a month long. I left the first facility two weeks in, I had it in my mind I could do it on my own and that I wouldn?t ever use again. I died that same month. I went back to a different place, and didn?t even make it a week before I was kicked out due to a verbal dispute with another client.

I?m back home now and it has only been two weeks since I overdosed. She?s scared. But she also has it in her head for some reason that she?s the main root of my addiction. It?s the complete opposite though. She is the only driving force keeping me from going all out. She just caught me snorting her suboxone after lying to her twice about not having touched it. I?m supposed to start the Naltrexone pill in 10 days and then hopefully get the Vivitrol injection soon after if all is well.

It all started back in September when my friend showed me a musician he found funny. He shows me new songs he finds pretty often and I usually don't like it but this time it was different. The musician in question blew my mind by his humour / the absolute banger that was the song / his unique accent

And it all started from there. Then I discovered all his other songs and I absolutely LOVED all of them. (and i'm usually super difficult when it comes to liking music.

As time went by , I kept falling further and further down the rabbit hole :

listening to all the interviews I could find, reading about him, learning every little thing I could to the point it was basically stalking his personnal life.

I even started a fan youtube account to archive all his interviews available online / performances/old content ( the guy isn't THAT famous , basically an up and comer from where I live so he even found out about the account..I was ashamed) .

Then, after a few weeks, it got worse. I discovered that the guy streams a few times a week on twitch. Guess who has watched EVERY SINGLE STREAM since september ?

Then I discovered he has a discord server where's he's super active with his fanbase.My addiction started to get way worse at this point since I could basically interact with him whenever I wanted.



So yeah,that's my problem right there. Since september, I only want to listen to his music and nothing else. I watch all his streams even when they last more than 5 hours.i'm.always.there.

All my spare time revolves around him to a certain point.I'm gonna go see him in concert 3 times this spring.

I hate myself for being that addicted. I have to distance myself from all of this. but at the same time.. it gives me so much joy. What have I become ? It's pathetic.

I promised myself to stop watching his streams from now on. Maybe watch some aftwerwards when he's offline ?

I promised myself to almost never post on his discord anymore and to not meet him when i'll see him in concert this spring.

For his music, i'll keep listening to it as it's not that much of a problem.

I originally wanted to go visit his hometown this summer since it's an absolutely beautiful small town by the ocean. but maybe I shouldn't..

Anyway. One day at a time. Crossing fingers that I can become just a regular casual fan , enjoying his music without getting so emotionaly attached.

Also, this is a throwaway account since I post sometimes about him on reddit and you could easily find who it is,so..

I've just finished watching Dopesick on Disney+ and it hit really close to home for me. The Sackler family behaved in a way that makes me absolutely sick, and watching the series has inspired me to share my story.

I suffered a knee injury in 2011, aged 16. I went to see my GP who and prescribed Co-Codamol 15/500 and referred me to a physiotherapist. I took the pills for a few weeks and went to my physio appointments to try to strengthen my knee back up. This went on for a while, but unfortunately my knee wasn't feeling any better, even after several months of therapy and several rounds of pain medication. Eventually I was referred to an orthopaedic consultant, who agreed I needed an MRI to see what was going on. The results of the MRI showed that I had torn cartilage in my knee and had also partially torn one of the main ligaments. The consultant suggested the best option for me was to go on the waiting list for surgery, which was around 1-1.5 years long at the time. I was happy to wait, as it had already been a few years of doctors? appointments, physiotherapy sessions and painkiller prescriptions ? and I thought the extra wait would be fine.

During the wait for the surgery, the pain seemed to get worse. I had stopped seeing the physiotherapist, as the consultant now knew that no amount of strengthening would fully ease my pain. However, I found the pain to increase after stopping. I went back to my GP, who was then able to prescribe Co-Codamol 30/500, double the dose I had previously been on, because by that stage I was over 18 years old.

Quickly I found myself becoming dependent on this medication. They helped my pain, but I can?t lie - I also enjoyed the way they made me feel. I would finish the prescription within 2 weeks, rather than 4, and top myself up with over-the-counter Co-Codamol, until it was time to get another prescription from my GP. This became a bit of a cycle for me - prescription, OTC, prescription, OTC....and so on.

I finally got the surgery in 2015 aged 20, yet the pain remained. I kept seeing my GP, who kept prescribing the medication and I kept taking it quite happily. I was extremely depressed during this time of my life. I had gained a lot of weight and I hated the way I looked. The only thing that made me feel good was the buzz I got when I took some type of codeine-based medication.

Eventually I started buying Dihydrocodeine, a strong codeine-based painkiller, from online pharmacies. I would get into a cycle where I was taking codeine for several weeks and then taking a break for a week or two. In my mind, the fact that I was able to stop for short periods meant I wasn't addicted.

I told myself that my ability to stop every so often meant that I didn't have a problem for a further 5 years until I completely lost control.

In March 2020, I found myself catching covid at work. It hit me pretty hard, and I ended up with pneumonia, pleurisy, and countless other chest infections which kept coming back every time I thought I was beginning to recover. The pain across my back from all the inflammation in my chest was agonising, and I took that opportunity to get more painkillers from my GP. They did help, but I had developed quite a high tolerance over the years and their effectiveness quickly diminished.

I started going back to pharmacies, sometimes up to 4 in one day, buying more and more codeine-based products. I was constantly thinking about which pharmacies I hadn?t used recently, which I had, and which ones I could use to avoid any suspicion. I would constantly lie about where I was going, just to get some pills.

I would also use online pharmacies to buy the stronger prescription only medications that I craved. I made accounts with several of these sites, did the health assessments for them all, and happily paid for my prescription to be delivered to my door. This then opened the door for me to start looking for other medications online.

After a month or two of lockdowns and isolation, I found that codeine was no longer enough for me, and I started looking into buying diazepam and other benzodiazepines online. This sent me into a complete downward spiral, as I was buying any pills I could get my hands on, from any sources available. This (most of the time) meant that I was receiving pills from India, which were more than likely completely fake.

I was also drinking quite heavily during this time ? an extremely dangerous thing to do when you?ve been taking upwards of 30 pills a day. On one occasion, a friend had to come to my house and almost pull me out of the hot tub. I had taken a handful of pills (a mixture of codeine & benzodiazepines) and then started drinking cocktails for the afternoon. We had been texting throughout, but when I suddenly stopped responding, she naturally became extremely concerned. She arrived to find me almost passed out in the hot tub by myself with a drink in my hand. That was probably one of my lowest points to date. But it wasn?t enough to stop me.

On another occasion, I remember waking up and finding 4 diazepam remaining in one of the sleeves I had received in the post on the previous day. There were 60 diazepam in total, and only 4 remained. I had taken 56 of them the night before (alongside a lot of alcohol) and had absolutely no recollection of doing so. To this day I still don?t know if I did this on purpose and that terrifies me. I have overdosed on numerous occasions in the past, but never on purpose. Never for a reason. So to think that I was possibly in a place where I may have purposely overdosed to end my life is one of the scariest thoughts I have.

By the Summer of 2020, I was just a shell of the person I used to be. My own mother barely recognised me, which is still a painful thought to this day. When I was eventually sat down in July for the final time and told my behaviour needed to stop, I took action. Admitting I had a problem was one of the hardest things I had to do, but I?m so glad that I did. Up until that point, I had denied any allegations of substance abuse and completely ignored any help or advice that was given to me. This time was different. Things needed to change.

I went back to work and did my best to resist any temptations to go back to my old ways. I stopped benzodiazepines almost immediately, then I worked on giving up the painkillers, then cut down on alcohol a few weeks later. I suppose I was lying to myself at the time about my alcohol consumption too, but I eventually got that under control (one battle at a time, am I right?).

From March-July, I was in a very dark place. I can safely say that I absolutely hit rock bottom and then kept going. I don?t know how much longer I would have survived if I didn?t have the family and friends that I do. Everything I did during that time should have pushed them away, but they stuck with me though it all and I?m extremely grateful to them for essentially saving my life.

As of today, I have been clean of benzos for 581 days and codeine-based pain meds for 568 days. I do still drink alcohol, but I?m happy with my consumption these days. I had a lot of underlying mental health issues which accelerated my alcohol consumption back then, but these have now been acknowledged and addressed, and I can safely say that I now enjoy a drink in moderation in a social setting only. I don?t wake up with shame and regret anymore ? just a content feeling of a night well spent, and I think that?s something I can really be proud of.

I?m 16 years old and I want to start smoking, but at the same time I don?t. I know most are going to say it?s unhealthy, addicting, and not to do it. However, I can?t get it out of my mind. Whenever, I pass one in a pack in the store with my mom, I imagine myself smoking one. The thought of cigarettes is like stuck in my head and drawing me in, even though I know I will die early from doing it if I ever did it. What should I do? I know it sounds weird.

When I was younger the one thing I couldn't get over was the perception that I was limiting myself, that I was denying myself the freedom to choose in this one area. the freedom to use once in a while. Skip ahead 25 years of abuse, neglect, and watching all my dreams, and efforts, go down the tubes along with my relationships, and reputation. And accepting this one limitation has given me complete freedom to rebuild my life. It's restored most of my health my ability to think and reason and won me back the people I love. I'm even right on the verge of getting a job back in corporate America and being able to put my degree to use. My reception of the lost ability to choose was absurd. You can really save yourself some heartache by listening to those that have been down this road. Give yourself a chance Let Hope friendship and love back into your life. Let go of these demons.

Nicotine dreams running on caffeine steam, free basing the brew right off the top of the mug, drowning in cigarette smoke, blurring up the mirror...

tricking the habitual self into an acetylcholon-ic shock, interrupting the transmission of one's parasympathetic spots...

littered all along the nervous system, contracting muscles, dilating blood vessels, increasing secretions, and fluctuating the hearts biological rhythm...

Hijacking the natural reward captains, of one's ship...

To legit to quit...

Overcoming the sufferings of an unrealistic expectation... Assuming exceptions to prove the rules...

Recognizing the process... Exercising this awareness... Challenging carelessness...

Complex interactions of the mind are begging to be simplified...

Solve for X... Or was it Y?

Environmental hazards mixed in with genetics... Changing the variables Eliciting different results...

Impulse controls over the judgement of one's whole...

Completely recovering from the discovery of: what we are not... Excited to get on top, and see, who we might really be...

Pre-contemplation leads to contemplation... No need for any further compensation...

The ambivalent denial of that which seems to become impossible enters a realm of that which is probable when we acknowledge the humility of our own personal struggle...

Taking action Making things happen..

Establishing a sense of ambition... With something to achieve...

...Beyond belief...

Supportive people, with open arms... Reduce harm, and Eliminate the internalized alarms...

Setting boundaries... Following steps... From stone to stone... Knowing, that even when it seems like you are on your own, still, you are not alone...

Navigating through anxiety... Rebuilding one's society... With better mental health provisions, providing greater mental wealth decisions... Deciding to invest in the developments of a deeper breath...

But, the cognitive behavioral truth is that things will never be the same again... And so we must embrace the burdens of what we've been learning such that we may turn them into gold... The substance of our soul... Something to behold...

"A Mindful therapeutic beauty that simply must unfold"

Family therapy involves a therapist and family members to better solve family conflicts. Family therapy is a group of therapeutic treatments that aim to harness the family's strengths and resources to help them live a drug-free life. It also aims to lessen the impact of addiction on both the addict and his or her family.

I gave up these badboys when I was 30, in that I gave up smoking it all day, every day. But then I was drinking and eating (like a monster) then too - and just very unaware of any of my coping mechanisms, (pre autism & adhd diagnosis & general self discovery on the next level...)

I'm functioning and flowing through life like a melancholy ghost but irritable beyond belief, of course all the usual silliness of withdrawal, but then there's the existential dread that is just making me feel like a perpetually short fusing circuit that's about to be sucked into a black hole.

Smoking will make it all go away but then it will come back worse, so I can't possibly prolong the inevitable any longer...

Please god, is there anyone out there with some grounding, earthing, reassuring, understanding, motivating words to help me through this. I can't remember how long this lasts... am I going to be okay??

I need to go through my mom's insurance in order to go to an addiction centre for help and this is what I'm having trouble with. For some reason I feel comfortable telling her that I have mental health issues, anxiety depression OCD, but nothing that is physical if that makes sense, my PTSD or addiction. The other mental health issues I was born with, but the others came along when I was 14/15.
